relation: No Constant Burning Pilot, Automatic Means for Adjusting Water Temperature
pageTitle: 42 U.S. Code § 6295 - Energy conservation standards | LII / Legal Information Institute
textBeforeTable: The following is the maximum energy use allowed in kilowatt hours per year for the following products (other than those described in paragraph (2)) manufactured on or after January 1, 1990: (1) Standards for refrigerators, refrigerator-freezers, and freezers (b) authorize the Secretary to prescribe amended or new energy conservation standards for each type (or class) of covered product. (2) provide Federal energy conservation standards applicable to covered products; and (1) The purposes of this section are to— Purposes (a) next prev | Authorities (CFR) Notes US Code -->
textAfterTable: Side mounted freezer with through the door ice 30.9 AV 547 Upright Freezers with: Manual defrost 10.9 AV 422 Automatic defrost 16.0 AV 623 Chest Freezers and all other freezers 14.8 AV 223 (2) The standards described in paragraph (1) do not apply to refrigerators and refrigerator-freezers with total refrigerated volume exceeding 39 cubic feet or freezers with total refrigerated volume exceeding 30 cubic feet. (3) (A) (i) The Secretary shall publish a proposed rule, no later than July 1, 1988, to determine if the standards established by paragraph (1) should be amended. The Secretary shall publish a final rule no later than July 1, 1989, which shall contain such amendment, if any, and provide that the amendment shall apply to products manufactured on or after January 1, 1993. If such a final rule is not published before January 1, 1990, any amendment of such standards shall apply to products manufactured on or after January 1, 1995. Nothing in this subsection provides any justification or defense for a failure by the Secretary to comply with the nondiscretionary duty to publish final rules by the dates stated in this paragraph.
